title: Authors and Citation

code: @Manual{,   title = {fwatlasbc: Freshwater Atlas British Columbia},   author = {Joe Thorley and Sebastian Dalgarno},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.1.9018},   url = {https://poissonconsulting.github.io/fwatlasbc/}, }

title: Freshwater Atlas British Columbia
text: fwatlasbc R package querying data Freshwater Atlas (FWA) British Columbia. Spatial data returned simple features. fwatlasbc wraps fwapgr R package uses fwapg API.

title: Freshwater Atlas British Columbia
text: can install latest version fwatlasbc GitHub :

title: Freshwater Atlas British Columbia
text: Find stream names using regular expression. may one stream name matches regular expression. Add blue line keys (blk) stream names. may multiple streams name. Alternatively get nearest blue line key river meter (rm) longitude latitude. river meter distance meters fish swims mouth river. distance_to_lon_lat far original point stream meters. Get watershed (aggregating fundamental watersheds) blue line key river meter (default 0). errors try increasing river meter. Get stream network watershed polygon. Note rm original watershed downstream/upstream_route_measure equivalents stream segment network. Convert stream network table blue line keys regularly spaced river meters starting 0. Plot watershed, network river meters.
code: library(fwatlasbc) streams <- fwa_find_stream_names("steep c") streams #> # A tibble: 2 × 1 #>   stream_name        #>   <chr>              #> 1 Steep Canyon Creek #> 2 Steep Creek blks <- fwa_add_blks_to_stream_name(streams) blks #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #>   stream_name              blk #>   <chr>                  <int> #> 1 Steep Canyon Creek 360883036 #> 2 Steep Creek        356362258 #> 3 Steep Creek        356534225 #> 4 Steep Creek        356570155 blks <- blks[blks$blk == 356534225, ] fwa_add_blk_to_lon_lat(data.frame(lon = -132.26, lat = 53.36)) #> Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 5 fields #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 585153.6 ymin: 946162.9 xmax: 585153.6 ymax: 946162.9 #> Projected CRS: NAD83 / BC Albers #> # A tibble: 1 × 6 #>     lon   lat       blk    rm distance_to_lon_lat            geometry #>   <dbl> <dbl>     <int> <dbl>               <dbl>         <POINT [m]> #> 1 -132.  53.4 360824839 1118.                508. (585153.6 946162.9) wshed <- fwa_add_watershed_to_blk(blks) wshed #> Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 3 fields #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 1656219 ymin: 725423.4 xmax: 1661727 ymax: 732146.6 #> Projected CRS: NAD83 / BC Albers #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   stream_name       blk    rm                                           geometry #>   <chr>           <int> <dbl>                                      <POLYGON [m]> #> 1 Steep Creek 356534225     0 ((1658107 728965.2, 1658107 728965.2, 1658180 728… network <- fwa_add_collection_to_polygon(wshed, "stream_network") network #> Simple feature collection with 76 features and 29 fields #> Geometry type: LINESTRING #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 1656200 ymin: 725423.4 xmax: 1661368 ymax: 731603 #> Projected CRS: NAD83 / BC Albers #> # A tibble: 76 × 30 #>    stream_name       blk    rm blue_line_key blue_line_key_50k #>    <chr>           <int> <dbl>         <int>             <int> #>  1 Steep Creek 356436505     0     356436505                NA #>  2 Steep Creek 356526193     0     356526193               873 #>  3 Steep Creek 356566041     0     356566041              1130 #>  4 Steep Creek 356549188     0     356549188              1131 #>  5 Steep Creek 356566041     0     356566041              1130 #>  6 Steep Creek 356394005     0     356394005                NA #>  7 Steep Creek 356534225     0     356534225              1142 #>  8 Steep Creek 356549188     0     356549188              1131 #>  9 Steep Creek 356526193     0     356526193               873 #> 10 Steep Creek 356566041     0     356566041              1130 #> # ℹ 66 more rows #> # ℹ 25 more variables: downstream_route_measure <dbl>, edge_type <dbl>, #> #   feature_code <chr>, feature_source <chr>, fwa_watershed_code <chr>, #> #   gnis_id <int>, gnis_name <chr>, gradient <dbl>, left_right_tributary <chr>, #> #   length_metre <dbl>, linear_feature_id <int>, local_watershed_code <chr>, #> #   localcode_ltree <chr>, stream_magnitude <dbl>, stream_order <dbl>, #> #   upstream_route_measure <dbl>, waterbody_key <dbl>, … # rms <- fwa_convert_stream_network_to_rms(network, interval = 100) # rms ggplot2::ggplot() +   ggplot2::geom_sf(data = wshed) +   ggplot2::geom_sf(data = network, color = "blue") +   #  ggplot2::geom_sf(data = rms) +   NULL

title: Freshwater Atlas British Columbia
text: fwatlasbc supersedes archived fwabc retrieved data via WFS using bcdata.

title: Freshwater Atlas British Columbia
text: fwatlasbc relies fwapg API created, maintained hosted Simon Norris Hillcrest Geographics.

title: Freshwater Atlas British Columbia
text: Please report issues. Pull requests always welcome.

title: Freshwater Atlas British Columbia
text: Please note fwatlasbc released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

what: Add Blue Line Key to Longitude and Latitude — fwa_add_blk_to_lon_lat
title: Add Blue Line Key to Longitude and Latitude — fwa_add_blk_to_lon_lat
text: Adds integer blue line key (blk) numeric river meter (rm) column sfc point (geometry) column closest point stream network (default within 5 km) point specified lon lat (WGS84).

title: Add Blue Line Key to Longitude and Latitude — fwa_add_blk_to_lon_lat
code: fwa_add_blk_to_lon_lat(   x,   tolerance = 5000,   limit = 1,   epsg = getOption("fwa.epsg", 3005),   nocache = getOption("fwa.nocache", FALSE) )

title: Add Blue Line Key to Longitude and Latitude — fwa_add_blk_to_lon_lat
text: x data frame numeric longitude (long) latitude (lat) columns. tolerance number tolerance m. limit positive whole number indicating maximum number features return. epsg positive whole number EPSG projection geometry. nocache flag specifying whether cache results.

title: Add Blue Line Key to Longitude and Latitude — fwa_add_blk_to_lon_lat
text: sf tibble columns x plus integer column blk, real columns rm distance_to_lon_lat sfc point column geometry

title: Add Blue Line Key to Longitude and Latitude — fwa_add_blk_to_lon_lat

code: fwa_add_blks_to_stream_name(data.frame(stream_name = "Sangan River")) #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>   stream_name        blk #>   <chr>            <int> #> 1 Sangan River 360879896

title: Add Collection to Polygon — fwa_add_collection_to_polygon
text: Adds collection polygon watershed. active sfc polygon column called geometry replaced geometry column collection. collection includes blue_line_key column values copied column blk replacing existing values.

title: Add Collection to Polygon — fwa_add_collection_to_polygon
code: fwa_add_collection_to_polygon(   x,   collection = "stream_network",   intersect = FALSE,   filter = NULL,   limit = 10000,   offset = 0,   properties = NULL,   transform = NULL,   epsg = getOption("fwa.epsg", 3005),   nocache = getOption("fwa.nocache", FALSE) )  fwa_add_collection_to_watershed(   x,   collection = "stream_network",   intersect = FALSE,   filter = NULL,   limit = 10000,   offset = 0,   properties = NULL,   transform = NULL,   epsg = getOption("fwa.epsg", 3005),   nocache = getOption("fwa.nocache", FALSE) )

title: Add Collection to Polygon — fwa_add_collection_to_polygon
text: x sf object active sfc polygon column. collection character string collection. intersect logical vector specifying whether intersect individual features polygon opposed just including features intersect . filter named vector list filter(s) apply, list names correspond column names list values correspond desired value, e.g. list(gnis_name = "Sangan River"). limit positive whole number indicating maximum number features return. offset positive whole number indicating offset start returned results. properties vector strings column names include. NULL (default), columns retained. transform character vector name valid transform function followed parameter values (e.g. c("ST_Simplify", 100)) epsg positive whole number epsg transform features . nocache flag specifying whether cache results.

title: Add Collection to Polygon — fwa_add_collection_to_polygon
text: sf object

code: fwa_add_new_blk_rm_to_blk_rm(   x,   y,   blk = "blk",   rm = "rm",   blk2 = "blk",   rm2 = "rm",   new_blk = "new_blk",   new_rm = "new_rm",   new_blk_to = new_blk,   new_rm_to = new_rm )

title: Add New Blue Line Key and River Meter to Blue Line Key and River Meter — fwa_add_new_blk_rm_to_blk_rm
text: x tibble (sf object) blk rm columns. y tibble (sf object) unique blk rm columns new blk (optional) rm columns. blk string name blk column x. rm string name rm column x. blk2 string name blk column y. rm2 string name rm column y. new_blk optional string name new blk column y. NULL used join. new_rm string name new rm column y. new_blk_to string specifying name rename new blk column . new_rm_to string specifying name rename new blk column .

title: Convert Stream Network to River Meters — fwa_convert_stream_network_to_rms
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ watershed <- fwa_add_watershed_to_blk(data.frame(blk = 356308001, rm = 1000)) network <- fwa_add_collection_to_polygon(watershed) fwa_convert_stream_network_to_rms(network, interval = 100) } # }

what: Convert Streams to River Meters — fwa_convert_streams_to_rms
title: Convert Streams to River Meters — fwa_convert_streams_to_rms
text: Converts tibble streams river meters. Unlike fwa_convert_stream_network_to_rms() requires linestrings unique integer identifier stream.

title: Convert Streams to River Meters — fwa_convert_streams_to_rms
code: fwa_convert_streams_to_rms(   x,   interval = 5,   gap = 1,   end = NULL,   elevation = FALSE,   reverse = integer() )

title: Convert Streams to River Meters — fwa_convert_streams_to_rms
text: x sf tibble column blk linestrings streams. interval positive whole number distance (m) points. gap positive real number specifying maximum gap (m) mouth stream parent stream considered connected. end positive whole number indicating far (m) end stream linestring last interval included.  default end = NULL (equivalent end = interval + 1) excludes ends. elevation flag specifying whether use elevation Google Maps determine stream direction (use direction provided linestrings) reverse whole numeric vector streams reverse direction ignoring elevation.

title: Convert Streams to River Meters — fwa_convert_streams_to_rms
text: sf tibble columns blk, integer column rm sf column point geometry.

title: Convert Streams to River Meters — fwa_convert_streams_to_rms
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ watershed <- fwa_add_watershed_to_blk(data.frame(blk = 356308001, rm = 1000)) network <- fwa_add_collection_to_polygon(watershed) network <- select(network, blk = blue_line_key) fwa_convert_streams_to_rms(network, interval = 100) } # }

what: Snap River Meter to River Meters — fwa_snap_rm_to_rms
title: Snap River Meter to River Meters — fwa_snap_rm_to_rms
text: Assigns closest river meter river meters based blue line keys. x already includes new_rm column non-missing values preserved. non-missing new_rm values must ordered (respect x$rm) must present rm$rm. x already includes new_blk river meters can assigned creek different blue line key /river meters multiple creeks can assigned creek (example case previously unmapped side channel mainstem).

title: Snap River Meter to River Meters — fwa_snap_rm_to_rms
Snap River Meter to River Meters — fwa_snap_rm_to_rms
text: x sf object spatial points blk rm columns optional new_rm integer new_blk columns. rm sf object spatial point blk rm columns. snap_mouths flag specifying whether snap pairs streams mouths (rm = 0) new_rm already set.

title: Snap River Meter to River Meters — fwa_snap_rm_to_rms
text: updated version x integer columns blk, rm, new_blk, new_rm numeric column distance_to_new_rm.

title: Snap River Meter to River Meters — fwa_snap_rm_to_rms
text: closest river meter snapped rm (blk = new_blk) missing new_rm values replaced corresponding rm value. new_rm values ordered adjusting values firstly previous values greater provided new_rm value subsequent values less maximum previous value. Next runs two identical new_rm values include provided new_rm interpolated previous subsequent new_rm values based original rm spacing snapped closest rm value rm. ensure pairs streams snap mouths set new_rm 0 rm 0 set snap_mouths = TRUE

title: Snap River Meter to River Meters — fwa_snap_rm_to_rms
code: rm <- fwa_add_rms_to_blk(data.frame(blk = 356308001)) x <- rm[rm$rm %in% c(0, 2000, 5000, 6000, 7000), ] rm <- rm[rm$rm %in% c(1000, 3000, 4000, 8000, 9000, 10000), ] fwa_snap_rm_to_rms(x, rm) #> Simple feature collection with 5 features and 6 fields #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 1290725 ymin: 467231.2 xmax: 1294079 ymax: 469483.5 #> Projected CRS: NAD83 / BC Albers #> # A tibble: 5 × 7 #>         blk   new_blk    rm new_rm distance_to_new_rm elevation #>       <int>     <int> <int>  <int>              <dbl>     <dbl> #> 1 356308001 356308001     0   1000               874.      9.63 #> 2 356308001 356308001  2000   3000               536.      7.5  #> 3 356308001 356308001  5000   4000               754.      9.78 #> 4 356308001 356308001  6000   8000               905.      9.78 #> 5 356308001 356308001  7000   8000               515.      9.78 #> # ℹ 1 more variable: geometry <POINT [m]>

title: fwatlasbc: Freshwater Atlas British Columbia — fwatlasbc-package
text: Maintainer: Joe Thorley joe@poissonconsulting.ca (ORCID) Authors: Sebastian Dalgarno dalgarno@unbc.ca (ORCID) contributors: Poisson Consulting [copyright holder, funder]

title: fwatlasbc 0.0.1.9018
text: Added fwa_convert_stream_names_to_blks().

title: fwatlasbc 0.0.1.9017
text: Add reverse argument allow streams reversed. fwa_convert_streams_to_rms() now buffers deal inaccuracies streams network. Fix fwa_convert_streams_to_rms() getting wrong half split!

title: fwatlasbc 0.0.1.9016
text: Added snap_mouths = FALSE fwa_snap_rms_to_rms(). Added snap_mouths = FALSE argument fwa_snap_rm_to_rms().

title: fwatlasbc 0.0.1.9015
text: Added fwa_add_new_blk_rm_to_blk_rm(). Added fwa_join_stream_segments(). Added fwa_convert_streams_to_rms(). Added fwa_mapview_rms_to_rms(). Adding fwa_mapview_rms_to_rms(). Adding fwa_snap_rms_to_rms(). Merge pull request #58 poissonconsulting/rmtorms. Rmtorms fwa_snap_rm_to_point() now retains blk match. Updated stream names. Added nocache = getOption("fwa.nocache", FALSE) argument. Replace .data$name “name” select statements. fwa_add_watershed_to_blk() now provides general error watershed undefined blk rm. Collections longer include upstream_area_ha. distance_to_lon_lat now rounded mm.

title: fwatlasbc 0.0.1.9014
text: Added fwa_convert_rms_to_streams() convert rms sf point object sf linestring object. Added fwa_prune_rms() prune tips. Added fwa_add_cut_rm(). fwa_add_section_to_rms() now preserves geometry. fwa_add_section_to_rms() now preserves sf.

title: fwatlasbc 0.0.1.9013
text: Added fwa_add_downstream_split_to_rms(). Soft-deprecated fwa_add_split_to_rms() fwa_add_upstream_split_to_rms().

title: fwatlasbc 0.0.1.9012
text: Preserve point characteristics adjusting fwa_swap_branches().

title: fwatlasbc 0.0.1.9011
text: Added fwa_mapview(). fwa_convert_stream_network_to_rms() now excludes channels stream order 1 parents. Added ... argument fwa_snap_rm_to_point() allow assignment additional columns.

title: fwatlasbc 0.0.1.9010
text: Switch new fwapgr endpoint.

title: fwatlasbc 0.0.1.9009
text: Fixed internal group_split() active geometry preserved.

title: fwatlasbc 0.0.1.9008
text: Added swap_branches_rms(). Added fwa_parent_stream_name_rms(). Added fwa_parent_blk_rms(). Added stream_name = fwatlasbc:fwa_stream_name argument fwa_add_blks_to_stream_name(). Added fwa_mapview_rms(). Added fwa_swap_branches_rms().

title: fwatlasbc 0.0.1.9007
text: Added fwa_add_intersection_to_geometry(). Added chunk_size digits arguments fwa_add_gm_elevation_to_point(). Added fwa_add_gm_elevation_to_point().

title: fwatlasbc 0.0.1.9006
text: Renamed fwa_add_rm_to_lon_lat() fwa_add_blk_to_lon_lat().

title: fwatlasbc 0.0.1.9005
text: Soft-deprecated fwa_add_collection_to_watershed() fwa_add_collection_to_polygon(). Change behaviour fwa_add_collection_to_watershed() copies blue_line_key blk present. Added fwa_add_split_to_rms().

title: fwatlasbc 0.0.1.9004
text: Added fwa_convert_stream_network_to_rms(). Renamed fwa_add_section_to_rm() fwa_add_section_to_rms()

title: fwatlasbc 0.0.1.9002
text: Added fwa_add_rm_to_lon_lat(). Added fwa_add_stream_name_to_blk(). Exported fwa_stream_name data. Moved rm argument fwa_add_watershed_to_blk() column argument x.

title: fwatlasbc 0.0.1.9001
text: Switched column names snake case. fwa_add_rms_to_blk() removed Z coordinate returned geometry column added numeric elevation column.

title: fwatlasbc 0.0.1.9000
text: previous version.

title: fwatlasbc 0.0.1
